text: the united states is expected to relax
travel restrictions on vaccinated
passengers from the european union and
britain the new rules are expected to
come into effect from november let's
hear more on this from our washington
correspondent gary o'donoghue and notta
a moment too soon many will say gary
yeah i think there'll be a lot of relief
in europe and the uk obviously in
ireland for this change because up until
now there's been a sort of asymmetry to
the travel restrictions in other words
americans have been able to travel to
europe and the uk pretty easily
providing they took tests and were
vaccinated etc that wasn't true the
other way around for the last 18 months
most british people have not been able
to come to the us and so that's been a
bone of contention we we were expecting
perhaps some change to take place to
that back at the g7 meeting in cornwall
it didn't happen they've been talking
ever since
and now they've come to an agreement so
what happens now from november if you're
double vaccinated in the uk
you'll have to take a test within three
days of travel but you will be able to
get on a plane to the us and you won't
have to quarantine when you get here now
if you're a us citizen and you haven't
been vaccinated that actually the
restrictions are being tightened for you
if you're outside this country you'd
have to take a test within one day of
traveling back home to the united states
and then a test when you get here the
other thing that travelers from the uk
will have to do is give up their mobile
phone numbers and emails for contact
tracing as the the centers for con
disease control here is going to
institute some sort of contract tracing
uh method and i presume that's about the
dangers of new variants and things like
that but good news for
families that have been separated good
news for the tourism industry the
airlines have been crying out for this
for forever and of course business has
wanted things to open up and has been
lobbying hard for this and and finally
the americans have agreed
the
new british foreign secretary uh liz
trust says taken to social media she
said if we can have a little look at
what she's said on twitter excellent
news for travelers from the uk to the
u.s important for our economic recovery
families and trade she says how much of
this is down to ongoing diplomatic chats
behind the scene gary as opposed to the
science of covert
well the interesting thing is there has
been this working group talking about
opening things up since the g7 between
europe uk us but nothing really has
emerged from it we didn't really
necessarily expect something
expectations were were dashed really at
g7 and nothing really has emerged since
other than that they were sticking to
the rules so this is somewhat out of the
blue i mean it does help i think in in
the sense that it not only you know does
the the obvious things but of course
america is
uh facing a lot of criticism from some
european allies over all sorts of things
at the moment not least from the french
on uh the way they handled the new uh
alliance with uk and australia over the
afghanistan withdrawal so this will help
perhaps smooth over some of those um
those problems that they've had
diplomatically i don't think that would
necessarily have been the motivating
factor but it will certainly help and
you know it will normalize things the
other thing to point out of course is
that the dominant variant here in the
united states is the the delta variant
which is the same as it is in the uk so
in the sense you could say what's the
risk particularly as the the levels of
vaccination are higher in the uk than
they are here i think if a new variant
emerged maxine in the uk or europe that
might change the calculation
um from the point of view in the united
states they haven't said that but that
would be an obvious thing to think about
but as things stand at the moment they
think they can do this whilst keeping
the the population here
safe
gary for the moment thank you very much
gary donahue in washington boris johnson
has also been tweeting about this
development he says
the easing of u.s travel rules
for fully vaccinated travelers is a
fantastic boost for business and trade
very similar then to what liz trust is
saying they both got the memo
adding that it was great that family and
friends on both sides of pond can be
